ygData.subject: Re: feign death
ygData.msgSnippet: Not a chance... Especially at high lvls...
ygData.messageBody:
Not a chance... Especially at high lvls...


>From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] feign death
>Date: Sat, 18 Sep 1999 22:45:52 PDT
>
>From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>
>
>ive never actually seen it, but ive heard about it (and read about it too).
>basically they just pound on a mob, feign, heal (bandage or mend), and kill
>it off.
>
>>From: "Naeeldar" <jackal@...>
>>
>>Monks can kite with Feign Death? What Exactly do you mean.
>>
>>Naeeldar
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Tony B <tonyb72@...>
>>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
>>Date: Saturday, September 18, 1999 3:26 PM
>>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] feign death
>>
>>
>> >From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>
>> >
>> >i havent tried that, but it should work, because monks can kite with
>>feign
>> >death. be sure you dont have autoattack on, however. on a side note, i
>> >know my experience may be different than others, but i have always found
>> >feign death to be a worthless spell, as the creatures are never fooled
>>by
>> >it, and then i cant even run or cast(click walk, get up, turn around,
>>and
>> >creep away because you have 3hp left). also, it has a rather high mana
>>cost
>> >for a lower lvl caster.
>> >
>> >my 2cp
>> >belphenor
>> >
>> >
>> >>From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
>> >>
>> >>Out of curiosity, Has anyone tried to stack DoT's then feign death.
>> >>Should that not do the extra damage since the monster would be withing
>> >>melee range for more then 18 seconds and not moving.
>> >>I was thinking something like DoT's feign death, wait, get up, shadow
>> >>step, DoT' feign death, critter dead.
>> >>Now, does DoT make the critter see through feign death??
>> >>
>> >>Darkmoon level 15 necromancer
>> >>
>> >>Just trying to think of new strategies for using my spells from level
>> >>16. Besides, what else am I going to do at work. ;)
